Context: The School of Social & Community Services at George Brown College offers programs focused on skills such as leadership, teamwork, communication, independent thinking, intervention know-how, community awareness, and professionalism, with a social justice lens. They have approximately 1,200 students each year. Notable organizations where previous students have gained work experience include the Child Development Institute, Sick Kids Hospital, YWCA Toronto, City of Toronto, and Toronto District School Board. Some international field education opportunities are available in Jamaica and India. Their Entry Advising service assists students in matching their skills, background, and career goals with program options. Information sessions are held to learn more about programs and have questions answered by faculty and staff. Tours can be arranged to visit classrooms, labs, and facilities. The college provides a free service called ask.george@georgebrown.ca for inquiries. Their contact number is 416-415-2000 (TTY: 1-877-515-5559). Their social media hub can be visited for more information. Field education requirements and college fee requirements should be verified by students. The information provided in the website is subject to change without notice.
